perturbation.original_text: Ladies and Gentlemen: El Banco Financial Corporation, a Georgia corporation (the "Company"), proposes, subject to the terms and conditions stated herein, to engage the sales agent identified on the signature page to this Agreement (the "Agent" or "you") to assist the Company on a "best efforts" basis in the sale of the Company's common stock, $.01 par value per share (the "Shares").
perturbation.changed_text: Ladies and Gentlemen: El Banco Financial Corporation, a Georgia corporation (the "Corporation"), proposes, subject to the terms and conditions stated herein, to engage the sales agent identified on the signature page to this Agreement (the "Representative" or "you") to assist the Corporation on a "best efforts" basis in the sale of the Corporation's common stock, $.01 par value per share (the "Securities").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Company' to 'Corporation', 'Agent' to 'Representative', and 'Shares' to 'Securities' introduces inconsistency. Later references to 'Company', 'Agent', and 'Shares' might be ambiguous, creating confusion about the agreement's scope and the parties' obligations.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will distribute the Prospectus or other offering materials in connection with the offering and sale of the Shares only as set forth in the Prospectus, and only in accordance with the 1933 Act and the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations promulgated under such statutes, and the laws of any state in which the Shares are qualified for sale.
perturbation.changed_text: The Corporation will distribute the Prospectus or other offering materials in connection with the offering and sale of the securities only as it deems appropriate, and in accordance with company policy.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Company' with 'Corporation' and 'Shares' with 'securities', while simultaneously removing any mention of the 1933 Act, the Exchange Act, and state laws, provides significant uncertainty. It becomes unclear what laws and requirements the distribution of the prospectus needs to align with, creating conflict and making the clause unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text: The Agent agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company, and its officers, directors, agents, organizers, representatives and affiliates and any other person, if any, who controls the Company or its affiliates within the meaning of the 1933 Act (these parties together with the Company are hereinafter referred to as the "Company Indemnitees") against any and all losses, claims, damages, liabilities and expenses (including reasonable costs of investigation and counsel's fees) arising out of or based upon the actions of the Agent or any of its respective employees, agents, representatives or affiliates (i) that constitute bad faith or gross negligence on the part of the Agent or any of its employees, agents, representatives or affiliates, (ii) that constitute violations of applicable federal or state laws or regulations on the part of the Agent or any of its employees, agents, representatives or affiliates, or (iii) that constitutes a violation of any of the Agent's agreements, representations or warranties contained in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Representative agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Business, and its officers, directors, agents, organizers, representatives and affiliates against any losses, claims, damages, liabilities and expenses arising out of the actions of the Representative or any of its employees. The Representative will not reimburse the Business if such claims arose out of gross negligence, violations of law or regulations, and violation of the Representative's agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Agent' to 'Representative', 'Company' to 'Business', and removing references to people who control the Company, while also eliminating counsel's fees, introduces contradictions. The original text uses “Company Indemnitees”, but this new wording is ambiguous. The second sentence now creates confusion. It is uncertain when they will be reimbursed or held harmless, opening up the chance of legal disputes.
